intro: Codonopsis dicentrifolia, commonly known as the two-veined codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive two-veined pattern on the underside. The flowers are usually pale blue or white, and they bloom in late spring to early summer.
